page.title: 03PECKFIELD COLLIERY
page.content: About a mile to the east of Garforth near{Micklefield,}is the site of {Peckfield Colliery.}The site is at the moment a rather ugly blot on the landscape, with the{derelict}remains of earlier activity. It opened in 1876 and closed on the 21st of October 198O. There will be a demolition order on the buildings as they are unsafe. At the present time men are sifting through the rubble for usable {coal} and then washing it. The mine was closed down for the simple reason that it would cost too much{money}to extract remaining{coal. The shaft is 2OO metres deep and a {paddy train}ran from the bottom of the shaft up to 3 miles underground to the {coal face.}Next to the mine are houses which at one time belonged to the officials of the pit and some are still occupied by former miners.
